items.from_string:
Title: Create example notebook for API Gateway streaming

Value Statement: As an MLOps Engineer introducing a new feature, I want to create an example notebook to demonstrate how to create streaming responses from a lambda

AC: 
1. Lambda Function Development

 Create Lambda handler for streaming Bedrock foundation model responses (invoke_model_with_response_stream)
 Create Lambda handler for streaming Strands agent responses
 Ensure Lambda handlers are compatible with API Gateway streaming response format (chunked transfer encoding)
 Document Lambda handler code inline with comments explaining streaming implementation details
Use Lambda deployment script (https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-ai-tenant-resources/tree/dev/tutorials/templates/strands_agent)

2. API Gateway Configuration

 Create or document API Gateway configuration that enables streaming responses
 Configure API Gateway integration with Lambda for streaming (HTTP API recommended for streaming support)
 Document required API Gateway settings for chunked transfer encoding
 Document any IAM permissions required for API Gateway to invoke Lambda
 Include authentication/authorization considerations for the API endpoint

3. Example Notebook

 Create Jupyter notebook demonstrating end-to-end streaming workflow
 Include notebook section explaining streaming concepts and benefits (reduced time-to-first-token, improved user experience)
 Include notebook section with Lambda handler code for reference (Bedrock streaming handler)
 Include notebook section with Lambda handler code for reference (Strands agent streaming handler)
 Include notebook section demonstrating how to invoke the streaming API endpoint from Python
 Include notebook section showing how to process and display streaming responses in real-time
 Include example output showing streamed tokens/chunks arriving incrementally
 Document any required dependencies (requests, httpx, boto3, etc.)
items.to_string:
Enable Claude Sonnet 4.5 integration across all environments to provide enhanced AI capabilities.

Value Statement

As a development team member and end user who interacts with AI-powered features and services, I need the ability to access and utilize Claude Sonnet 4.5 model capabilities consistently across Development, Staging, and Production environments so that I can leverage improved AI performance, enhanced reasoning capabilities, and ensure consistent user experiences across all deployment stages.

Acceptance Criteria
 * When a user makes requests to Bedrock in any environment (Dev, Staging, Production), the user has the ability to receive responses generated by Claude Sonnet 4.5 with improved performance and capabilities compared to previous model versions.
 * Verify that tagging works for cost tracking
 * Create the new Inference Profiles for all environment and test they work Dependencies This Story is dependent on the completion of VAEC ticket to add Claude 4.5 to our accounts

items.from_string:
Title: Create Langfuse Prototype (SBX) with Chart-Deployed Dependencies 

###Value Statement
As an Infrastructure Engineer, I need to deploy Langfuse to the sbx-kubernetes cluster with all dependencies running in-cluster so I can validate the basic deployment and enable LLM tracing functionality.

###Acceptance Criteria
Langfuse is deployed in the bip-ai namespace on sbx cluster via ArgoCD
Users can sign up and log in via the web UI
Langfuse is accessible via internal ALB at langfuse-sbx.bip.va.gov
All chart-deployed dependencies are running: PostgreSQL, ClickHouse, Redis/Valkey, S3(MinIO)
Wrapper Helm chart created in bip-ai-infrastructure repo
Values files created in bip-ai-infrastructure-values repo for sbx

###Assumptions
The sbx-kubernetes cluster has sufficient capacity for all in-cluster dependencies
nginx controller is installed and configured
ArgoCD is configured and can deploy from the repos

###Dependencies
None

###Notes
Uses official Langfuse Helm chart v1.5.19 as dependency in wrapper chart
Chart-deployed PostgreSQL (Bitnami) for database
Chart-deployed ClickHouse (Bitnami) for analytics (stays in-cluster per requirements)
Chart-deployed Redis/Valkey (Bitnami) for caching (temporary - will migrate to ElastiCache)
Chart-deployed MinIO (Bitnami) for S3-compatible storage (temporary - will migrate to S3)
ZooKeeper deployed as part of ClickHouse subchart
Secrets: langfuse-secrets with salt and nextauth-secret keys must be created before deployment
Redis auth disabled for initial deployment (needs proper secret management)
Out of Scope
RDS integration (Ticket 2)
S3 integration (Ticket 3)
ElastiCache integration (Ticket 4)
Production-grade secret management
Monitoring and alerting
Load testing
items.to_string: ###Value Statement As an Infrastructure Engineer, I need to migrate Langfuse from chart-deployed PostgreSQL to AWS RDS so we have a managed, scalable, and production-ready database with automated backups. ###Acceptance Criteria RDS PostgreSQL instance provisioned via Crossplane claim Langfuse successfully connects to RDS instance Chart-deployed PostgreSQL is disabled (postgresql.deploy: false) Database migrations run successfully against RDS Existing data migrated (if applicable) or fresh start confirmed Langfuse functionality verified after migration Assumptions Crossplane is configured with AWS provider Existing ai-rds-cluster composition can be used or adapted RDS instance can be accessed from sbx-kubernetes cluster (security groups configured) Dependencies Ticket 1 must be complete (Langfuse deployed and functional) ###Notes Use existing Crossplane RDS composition pattern from the team Configure connection details via values file (host, database name, credentials) May need to update Langfuse values for external PostgreSQL configuration Consider using Kubernetes secrets for database credentials ###Out of Scope Database performance tuning (can be follow-up) Multi-AZ configuration (depends on requirements) Read replicas

Value Statement: As a BIP AI MLops engineer who supports SCC, I need to ensure that the main M21 SageMaker pipeline is successfully added to Stage.

Acceptance Criteria: Push the M21 SageMaker Pipeline, debug and troubleshoot any issues that arise. If possible and with SCC approval, test the pipeline.

items.from_string: Story: As a BIP-AI Infra cloud engineer, I want to plan the migration of all resources using the current SageMaker domain execution role to the new shorter naming convention role that is already deployed so that we can deprecate the legacy naming convention that causes naming length issues for certain tenants. Assumptions: - The new shorter naming convention execution role is already deployed in each target AWS account/environment and is ready for use by all affected resources - The scope includes all environments where the legacy SageMaker domain execution role is in use (sbx, dev, stage, preprod, prod) unless explicitly excluded - The plan deliverable is a written document stored in a team-accessible location and linked from the ticket Acceptance Criteria: - Given the current environments when discovery is performed then the plan document lists all resource types and concrete resources currently referencing the legacy SageMaker domain execution role - Given an identified resource type when its configuration model is reviewed then the plan document states whether the execution role is mutable/immutable for that resource type and cites the specific mechanism/constraint that drives the conclusion - Given resources where the role reference is immutable when the migration approach is drafted then the plan document includes a safe path for each case (for example recreate/replace strategy) and the expected blast radius - Given the migration steps when tenant impact is assessed then the plan document specifies any expected downtime windows (or confirms no downtime), including best-case/likely/worst-case duration estimates - Given the migration steps when tenant responsibilities are assessed then the plan document lists required tenant actions after the change (if any), along with verification steps tenants can perform to confirm success - Given the overall migration approach when operational rollout is planned then the plan document includes a proposed schedule (phased by environment and/or tenant), prerequisites, and a rollback plan Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted
items.to_string:
*Story:* As a BIP-AI infrastructure engineer, I want to prevent our S3 buckets from bloating steadily which is increasing storage costs. Metrics show excess storage size in all environments (100s of GB) when total current file size is only a few hundred MBs.

*A/C:* * Determine the root cause of the s3 buckets growing
 * Prevent and clean up further bloat if possible
 * Draft a long-term fix or plan a future ticket to implement a long-term fix
This issue is cloned by BIP-30960
This issue is cloned by BIP-30959
This issue is cloned by BIP-30958

items.from_string: Value Statement: As a platform engineer who monitors Lambda health in DEV, I need the ability to visualize “success” by adjusting to how CloudWatch determines success so that Grafana panels accurately represent real invocation outcomes and pick up errors. Acceptance Criteria: When a user views the DEV Grafana Lambda Monitoring dashboard, the success is computed from CloudWatch (i.e., success is “invocation completed without any Errors”)

Acceptance Criteria: When a user views the PPD Grafana Lambda Monitoring dashboard, the success is computed from CloudWatch (i.e., success is “invocation completed without any Errors”)

Title: 2.3 - Provide adhoc support to SPA-C team to resolve technical issues 
Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant on the SPA-C team, I need the ability to receive timely support so that I can resolve issues and continue my work without unnecessary delays. 
Acceptance Criteria: When a user from SPA-C requests support, the support team responds and assists as needed. Manual validation: Confirm support requests are tracked and resolved. Update deployment dates in Confluence for each support ticket.

items.from_string:
Title: Fix MLOps dashboard to be tenant separated for each visual 

Value Statement: As a BIP AI Engineer who uses the MLOps Dashboard to monitor resource performance, I'd like the ability to view various metrics by tenant so that I can more quickly check the health of a tenant's resources

AC: When a user views the MLOps dashboard, they have the ability to view metrics by tenant (where applicable) Ex. Errors will be broken down by tenant
items.to_string:
Title: Get more familiar w/ Grafana, identify metrics that can be split up by tenant, and start work on this

Value Statement: As a BIP AI Engineer who uses the MLOps Dashboard to monitor resource performance, I'd like the ability to view various metrics by tenant so that I can more quickly check the health of a tenant's resources

AC: Look thru Cloudwatch logs, learn how queries/transformations work in Grafana, come up w/ a list of potential new visuals, start first steps of this

Notes: This should be more of a spike/research ticket

items.from_string: Fix MLOps dashboard to be tenant separated for each visual
items.to_string: Get more familiar w/ Grafana, identify metrics that can be split up by tenant, and start work on this
